explanation: The code computed the interval length as D = B - A, but when counting integers in an inclusive interval [A, B] the length must include both endpoints. This is an off-by-one error. I fixed it by changing that single line to D = B - A + 1 so the interval size is correct.
fixed_code:
inp=input().split()
A=inp[0]
A=int(A)
B=inp[1]
B=int(B)
C=inp[2]
C=int(C)
X=inp[3]
X=int(X)
D=B-A+1
if A>=X:
    print(1)
elif B<X:
    print(0)
else:    
    print(D/C)
